intro: Gastrolychnis alexeenkoi, commonly known as the Khabarovsk nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Far East of Russia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and other nightshades. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and produces small, purple flowers. Its berries are toxic and contain alkaloids, making it a plant of both botanical interest and caution. Gastrolychnis alexeenkoi is relatively rare and has limited distribution in its native habitat.
